title: Rounded swiss
content:
Any clues on what type is being used here for the Moscow Design Museum? I thought it might be Gravostyle from Optimo but not luck.  
Thanks in advance all!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317102907im_/http:/typophile.com/files/bb2b11806a9f8c68a47f8586ecf5b296-1_5815.jpg)

Font: 

 Gravur Condensed, Lineto 

Solved By: 

 [akira1975](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317102907/http:/typophile.com/user/4504 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [bb2b11806a9f8c68a47f8586ecf5b296.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317102907/http:/typophile.com/files/bb2b11806a9f8c68a47f8586ecf5b296.png) | 263.38 KB |
author: BeTheKid

comments.content:
T-Star by Gestalten comes close, but is missing the rounded-end strokes:  
 [https://www.fontshop.com/families/t-star](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317102907/https:/www.fontshop.com/families/t-star "https://www.fontshop.com/families/t-star")

Gravur Condensed is also similar.  
 [http://lineto.com/The+Fonts/Font+Categories/Text+Fonts/Gravur+Condensed/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317102907/http:/lineto.com/The+Fonts/Font+Categories/Text+Fonts/Gravur+Condensed/ "http://lineto.com/The+Fonts/Font+Categories/Text+Fonts/Gravur+Condensed/")

_Cyrillic and Greek versions of the Regular and Bold weights of this font are available on request._  
 [http://lineto.com/The+Fonts/Font+Categories/Text+Fonts/Gravur+Condensed/...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317102907/http:/lineto.com/The+Fonts/Font+Categories/Text+Fonts/Gravur+Condensed/Bold/About+this+Font/ "http://lineto.com/The+Fonts/Font+Categories/Text+Fonts/Gravur+Condensed/Bold/About+this+Font/")
Thanks for the help – Gravur seems to be the fit!
